title: @Riot KateyKhaos- Debonair Galio (late feedback and a few questions- Please read it anyways Katey)
body:
(NOTE: I already made this comment in the PBE Boards, but I'm not sure that Katey will notice it in time.)

Hey, Katey, before the skin is launched, may I ask why didn't the W shield get any new particles to match the new model (it still has the classic Galio model floating)? I believe that it still could and has a few more days to be changed like you did with Warden Nautilus' W shield particle. :)

I seriously LOVE the splash! ;D
I wish that his head would have been bigger like in the splash and his hands and fingers would have textures similar to the splash' more chunky and not-in-one-piece fingers, but that would probably make him stay in the PBE for another cycle, right? :P
I think that if the stuff I mentioned above will change, the skin would be perfect :) I won't mind it staying another cycle anyways.

replies.body:
Hey DwarvenGiant! 

First off, thanks for taking the time to leave feedback in regards to content! 

We chose to keep the base particle because he was a 750 RP skin, and those generally don't receive particles, unless it's what we deem 'quality of life'. For example, Waden Nautilus would look pretty silly with his base shields when the Warden skin isn't nautical (heh) at all. Warden Sivir fell into the same category - it'd look silly if she had a new weapon in her model, but threw her old one. We felt that his base shield didn't ruin the fantasy of Debonair, which is why he's still using the base.

Unfortunately, it's a bit too late to make any more changes to his guy, and he'll be shipping as is. 

I (as well as the other QA folks on the skins team) read all of the PBE comments left for a skin, even though we may not comment on all of them. We also relay said feedback to the team working on the skin for discussion. Although we don't make every change requested, we do try to listen to actionable feedback when possible - I think for the most part, Debonair Galio is a good example of this. 

Again, I really appreciate you being active on the boards - both live and PBE - and voicing your feedback! :]

the skin itself is good for being a 750 rp tier, the splash art looks great, way better than his base one.. this isn't relevant to this skin but i think he should receive a new base splash art and ability icons, they seem really outdated, even his vfx/sfx could use an update similar to what morg has on the pbe currently.

Alright, fair enough. :P
Thanks for replying! :)

TL;DR: Riot legitimizes any of its decisions (popular/unpopular, good/bad, right/wrong, etc.) by saying "we don't promise anything; here are some generalizations that we can ignore at will. Let those generalizations comfort you enough to convince you to place faith in our company until we inevitably do something you seriously disagree with, then enjoy simmering as we get away with it because we technically said we could do it."

You mean, "as is," as in like his one PBE re-release?

It's been 21 days since you asked us what we thought of his revisions... there are a fair bit of up-voted critiques asking for only further minor tweaks at this point. Why'd you even ask what we thought if you weren't going to be willing to make some more tweaks? At least, super minor ones.

Like a lot of critiques about texture (or lack thereof) & the purple.

You even said yourself...

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=mNBeEEkI,discussion-id=6UK0Aorg,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2015-03-12T20:16:56.136+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=mNBeEEkI,discussion-id=6UK0Aorg,comment-id=001800000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-12T21:13:08.745+0000)
>
> ...he's not coming out in Patch 5.6, so we're not rushing him by any means.

Feels rushed since it appears like your discussions with the team turned into "no, sorry, despite the continued critiques, we're shipping him out anyway; pipeline."

The things asked for in the thread aren't even outside the skin-tier, so what you're telling us is that they're rushing it out after all instead of giving it that little bit of extra TLC to please the consumers who were asked their feedback another time (now, to no avail & for what purpose?).

In my original comment, I did mention specifically that we don't make every change that is requested. 

You're absolutely entitled to your opinion in regards to the final outcome of the skin, and I won't argue it. I do however disagree in your points that the skin was rushed and that no feedback was listened to. 

In regards to the quotes - 

Yes, we did discuss potential changes we wanted to make, versus those we did not. Some changes were made based on feedback. Other feedback was discussed, and changes weren't made for various reasons. While some feedback was actionable, other was more of an opinion, and at the end of the day, it's the team's final call on how to handle the more opinionated feedback. 

He did not come out in Patch 5.6, correct. At that point, we were still discussing the feedback.

At the end of the day, we did listen to some player feedback, and the finished product is something that we feel works for a debonair skin for Galio.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=OAOx8MwT,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-04-03T01:03:33.272+0000)

Other feedback was discussed, and changes weren't made for various reasons. While some feedback was actionable, other was more of an opinion, and at the end of the day, it's the team's final call on how to handle the more opinionated feedback.

Please don't put words in my mouth, it's very rude; I didn't make the assertion that "no feedback was listened to."

And for what it's worth (you may not have meant it like this), I didn't mean rushed like art-wise... I mean you guys are putting it out before satisfying a number of the (imo) major critiques.

Also, what was the purpose of asking for further feedback if you weren't going to make any further changes? Feels pretty disappointing, like we were led to believe that more would be accomplished.

You did kind of give us that impression when you assured us that you were in no hurry (essentially), coupled with requesting more feedback; feels, to me, like we got led on by you :/

When I'd made the post mentioning that he'd been updated on the PBE, the main reason was to see if the changes we'd made based on the initial round of feedback were satisfactory, and in most cases, players were happy with what we had done. Of course, additional feedback was welcome at that time, since Debonair Galio was still on PBE, and we weren't to the point of shipping him. Everything was discussed, and the artists who worked on the skin made final calls. 

We make no promises that every change requested while a skin is on PBE will be made, and it's never the intention to lead players on when asking for feedback. 

There's a lot to be taken away from feedback, whether it's positive or negative, and even if we don't change something, for one reason or another, it's something to keep in mind for the future. A good example of this was the discussion that was had about 750 RP skins, and which types of champions players were more happy with - skins where the champions are particle light, or where the particles still make a lot of sense (i.e Urf the Nami-tee).
on a serious note, aren't you afraid that the splash art of the skin give a feeling of a bad guy more than a debonair guy? (he look like the bad guy of some disney movie or mafia film :s)

I can see it from both sides. 

I personally don't see it that way, but that could very well be due to me working on the skin, and seeing the splash in development. 

I think a gargoyle smiling is something many (including myself) haven't really seen before, so it does look a bit on the more evil side. Looking at the splash as a whole, it paints much more of a story. I think the other figures in the splash take away some of the 'bad guy' feelings.

don't know, the first thing that pop in my mind when I saw  the splash was Ratigan from The Great Mouse Detective, he his class but evil (and from what I can read on various lol community, poeple already put him as a godfather)

Maybe it's the fact he seems to speak to the other male gargoyl instead of the lady who is in the back of the picture (look like a mafia meeting drink party).
Having him trying to seduce the lady maybe would had lower that feeling of criminal business party ^^

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=OAOx8MwT,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-03T16:53:42.958+0000)
>
> When I'd made the post mentioning that he'd been updated on the PBE, the main reason was to see if the changes we'd made based on the initial round of feedback were satisfactory, and in most cases, players were happy with what we had done...

I think you're looking at the feedback from that thread too quantitatively... look at the upvotes & downvotes. Not everybody uses comments to provide feedback, many simply upvote those who've represented their sentiment sufficiently. I would say that the feedback overall (the second time around) was still much more negative than positive based on that thread.

I agree with you - upvotes and downvotes are important, and are part of the process of collecting feedback. If something is significantly upvoted or downvoted, it's usually something the team should talk about. 

A good example of this was giving Firecracker Jinx some kind of tattoo, since Mafia Jinx didn't have one, and players felt that her tattoos were something that really represented Jinx. A comment asking for a jade dragon tattoo was significantly upvoted in a PBE post, and the feedback was given to the team, which resulted in us adding a jade dragon tattoo. 

When we collect feedback, we're not looking at just one thread. We take a look at several sources - PBE boards, live boards, comments on sites such as Surrender@20, comments on the SkinSpotlights videos and Reddit. When I'm talking about the overall feeling, it's based on the consensus of several sources. 

I think this is super important because PBE boards will have feedback from players who have had hands on play time with a particular skin, whereas other sources are looking at the skin via video or pictures. They're two different angles, but they're both important.

The positive feedbacks are definitely the outliers in this situation, especially when viewing the critique from numerous sources... I'm all over the Reddit, each of the LoL news sites, & much more... I don't know where you took away that "...in most cases, players were happy with what we had done..." (if really valuing upvotes & downvotes too)?

Just looking at this one source alone, it's clear that it's overwhelmingly negative on a few key-points still: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/6UK0Aorg-feedback-debonair-galio

We could go through all the other sources one-by-one but they're all majorly negative so there's no point (imo from viewing all those same sources). I just don't get where in searching for feedback among all these sources you guys thought more players were happy than not. Because, I'll be frank, from a thorough scan... it's the opposite if you truly are taking upvotes & downvotes into consideration as well, so I'm just confused.

I wouldn't call that satisfactory, I don't understand why you do? I could go on to the other sources but it's a pretty overwhelmingly massive, negative trend (in my perspective). Especially for the hair, face, & purple.

I am curious about this too. I like Galio and use him on occasion. Riot did the same exact thing with Ashes marauder skin refusing to simply change the particle effects to red or black. That is the only complaint and was a huge outrage yet riot refused saying that it would no longer work in that price bracket even though others in the same bracket had more work.

In regards to Marauder Ashe, you're correct that we didn't change the particles because she was a 750 RP skin. I can understand where the confusion lies, since she does have other skins which have color-shifted particles. 

For clarification there, her previous skins were created before 2013, which was when we more clearly defined price tiers. As it stands now, 750 RP skins don't receive particle changes, unless it's something referred to as 'quality of life'. An example of this would be Warden Nautilus' shields changing because his base shields don't make any sense with the new skin.

After all the backlash shouldn't it have been considered that though? Everyone was begging for it because it's like beginning this beautiful piece of art then leaving a hole in the middle and never finishing. Considering how long it took ashe to finally get a dark, tough looking skin that suited her I along with all the ashe lovers I'm sure we're expecting at least the slight color change. Didn't have to change the look of the arrows at all just the color.
Is there anyway this could be remedied in the future?

There was a similar discussion from players around Sweetheart Annie since we didn't change her particles either. 

When we go into development for a skin, we have a scope in mind - what tier a skin will be, and the kinds of things we'll be adding to a skin. Based on that, we'll allocate resources accordingly; modelers, animators, particle artists, audio bros, etc. 

If we scope out a 750 RP skin, for example, we're only allocating a modeler, since 750 RP skins have new models/textures. We'll then allocate particle artists, etc to other skins (975 RP+) where we need those resources. 

Changing the color of a particle isn't as simple as moving a slider, and it involves editing layers of particles, which is why it's not as quick or  easy as players had initially though. 

The other reason for not changing the particles was because we didn't want to set a false precedence that we'd add particles to 750 RP skins and change the price to 975 RP whenever this kind of discussion came up. Our goal is to create skins of various tiers for champions because not everyone wants all of the bells and whistles that some skins have. Some players are happy with a new model and texture.

There are plenty of people who have posted directions and videos showing how simple it is. Also the price bracket excuse that keeps comming up was made invalid by riot itself when they gave particle recolors to other skins in the same price bracket....
Don't get me wrong I love Riot because you are a fan service company usually. Lately though it seems to be changing. Not taking in feedback that is repeatedly said because it's negative and talking in circles when asked about it. It seems like Riot is only doing what Riot wants now and that is not what it set out to be. I get you cannot take in all the feedback in the world that'd be insane, but when something is clamored for over and over it should be honestly taken into account and hopefully changed.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=OAOx8MwT,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-03T19:18:23.587+0000)
>
> Changing the color of a particle isn't as simple as moving a slider, and it involves editing layers of particles, which is why it's not as quick or  easy as players had initially though.

We've discussed this before but isn't that a poor excuse?

It's practically as simple as moving a slider... just apply-all the slider-values for however many layers.

Idk how many layers you have on average for your particles, but say it's five... I could accomplish a complete particle recoloring, layers & all, in under a minute.

So instead of it taking 15 seconds to slide one layer, you're taking a bit extra to copy the figures into other layers... and I'm sure there's a shortcut to "apply all" that cuts this process down even much further.

You said yourself that the team uses Photoshop to do this, I know for certain it's lightning quick to accomplish.

Idk, just feels like a very nasty cop-out :/

Since it is legitimately so quick & easy to do, why not start including it for 750's?

I think you're vastly overestimating how much work it is to use a slider & do a quick apply-all on the particle layers.

If it's not too late to change your guys' minds on this skin being final... this person really hit the nail on the head with their suggestions:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/z2V15dfb-riot-concernssuggestions-aboutfor-debonair-galio
